Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Joseph Gordon Papers
Gordon, Joseph, 1914-1942
TAM.082
0.75 Linear Feet in 2 manuscript boxes
1944-1954, undated Materials are in English, German and Czech. Separated from the American Committee for Cultural Freedom Records, this two box collection contains typed and handwritten manuscripts, articles, papers, and notes written by Joseph Gordon as well as correspondence. 1-2
Historical/Biographical Note
Joseph Gordon worked for the Library of Jewish Information, the American Jewish Committee and was the author of many studies on East European affairs.
Arrangement
The order in which these materials were sent to the Tamiment Library has been maintained.
Appraisal
These two boxes were separated from the American Committee for Cultural Freedom Records TAM 023. This material was created by Joseph Gordon. No materials were removed from this collection.
Scope and Contents
Separated from the American Committee for Cultural Freedom Records, this two box collection contains typed and handwritten manuscripts, articles, papers, and notes written by Joseph Gordon as well as correspondence. The articles, written in English, German, and Czech, mostly concern German, Russian, and Eastern European matters and especially anti-semitism. Some articles have an anti-communist bent, particularly those written for the U.S. International Information Administration of the U.S. State Department.
According to the original folder titles, Joseph Gordon often wrote under two different pseudonyms: Josef Guttman and Peter Meyer. Box 1 contains materials written by Joseph Gordon as himself and also as Josef Guttman. Box 2 is entirely devoted to the writings of Joseph Gordon as Peter Meyer. Both boxes contain typed and handwritten "manuscripts." Materials are not separated by language, so some folders may contain material in several different languages.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, a collection level finding aid was created and the material was moved to archival housing. In 2015 the finding aid was updated and a folder list was created.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Joseph Gordon Papers; TAM 082; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Conditions Governing Use
The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1944-1954, are expected to enter the public domain in 2047.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.031.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
